description:
MARS RED takes place in 1923, and vampires have existed for quite a while. But now, the number of vampires is increasing and a mysterious, artificial blood source called Ascra has appeared. The Japanese government, in turn, creates “Code Zero,” a unit within the army tasked with taking down the vampiric forces. And what better way to track vampires than by using vampires?

Created by Lieutenant General Nakajima, this unit has historically been in the business of information war, but has been re-assigned to solve the vampire crisis. It's up to Code Zero and the S-class vampire Deffrot to investigate this increase and put a stop to it before society crumbles.

(Source: Funimation)

Note: The first episode premiered on Funimation on March 29. Regular broadcast started on April 6, 2021.

[Official Site](https://www.hyde.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HydeOfficial_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hydeofficial) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@hyde_official) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPiJhfvRuQqQofd3xSZBQ1A)

Hideto Takarai, better known as HYDE, is a Japanese musician, vocalist, lyricist, record producer, actor and voice actor. He is best known as the vocalist for the rock band L'Arc~en~Ciel, as well as for the band Vamps. In the band L'Arc~en~Ciel he stylized his name as hyde, while in his solo projects and in the band Vamps he stylized it as HYDE. He is currently active in the band L'Arc~en~Ciel (1991–) under the name HYDE (2001–), while also a member of Vamps (2008–2017), who are currently on hiatus.

Jad is an American voice actress and ADR director who works for Funimation and Sentai Filmworks. Her name is an acronym of her parents' names, Jimmy and David, and is pronounced as Jade. Her singing led to her first voice role in Sasami: Magical Girls Club as Eimi Mori, and her first major voice role was Masako Hara in Ghost Hunt. She graduated summa cum laude from Texas Wesleyan University with a Bachelor of Arts in Music in 2005.

(Source: Wikipedia)
He is a director who belonged formerly to Studio Z, Studio Number One, Tatsunoko Pro and is now affiliated with Production I.G.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/146127066)

Started off as a production manager at [Shin-Ei](https://anilist.co/studio/247/).
